conclusion: Define v₀ as speed just before ball strikes floor, v₁ as speed just after it rebounds, g as gravitational acceleration, λmg as air-resistance force.
Net downward acceleration during fall is (1 – λ)g, and v₀² = 2(1 – λ)gH.
Net downward acceleration during rise is (1 + λ)g, and v₁² = 2(1 + λ)gh.
Calculate k = v₁ / v₀ = √[ (1 + λ)h / (1 – λ)H ].
The required ratio is v_after / v_before = √[ (1 + λ) h / (1 – λ) H ].
